com.dougnoel.sentinel.filemanagers

Class DownloadManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dougnoel.sentinel.filemanagers.DownloadManager

  • public class DownloadManager
extends Object
    Manages Download actions and interactions, which handles CRUD and IO for Sentinel. This includes deleting files, getting/setting files, filenames, or file extensions, monitoring downloads, verifying file has been downloaded, parsing PDF content for content verification, and

      • monitorDownload

        public static String monitorDownload()
        Monitors the current set download directory and returns a filename once the file is downloaded.
        Returns:
        String The name of the file that was downloaded.

      • monitorDownload

        public static String monitorDownload(String downloadDir,
                                     String fileExtension)
        Returns the name of a downloaded file by monitoring the given download directory and looking for a file to be downloaded with the given file extension. It checks the given directory every 1/10th of a second under the file download is complete, and then returns the name of the file downloaded. If the download takes longer than 20 seconds, the function times out and throws an error.
        Parameters:
        downloadDir - String path to the download directory.
        fileExtension - String extension of the file type you are expecting to be downloaded.
        Returns:
        String The name of the file that was downloaded.

      • verifyPDFContent

        public static boolean verifyPDFContent(URL url,
                                       String expectedText,
                                       int pageNumber)
                                throws IOException
        Returns true is the given text appears on a particular page of the passed PDF that is opened in a new tab, without needing to download it. It takes the URL of the PDF which can be done by using PageManager.getCurrentUrl() if the PDF is the active window. It also takes a string of the text you expect to find, and the page number you expect to find it on.
        Parameters:
        url - String URL of the PDF
        expectedText - String Text to be checked in the PDF.
        pageNumber - int Number of the page on the pdf to look for the text.
        Returns:
        boolean true if the text was found, false if it was not.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was an error in finding or opening the PDF

      • verifyPDFContent

        public static boolean verifyPDFContent(URL url,
                                       String expectedText,
                                       int pageStart,
                                       int pageEnd)
                                throws IOException
        Returns true if the given text exists within a particular page range of the passed PDF. This PDF is opened in a new tab, without needing to download it. It takes the URL of the PDF which can be done by using PageManager.getCurrentUrl() if the PDF is the active window. It also takes a string of the text you expect to find, and the page range you expect to find it on. The page range is inclusive, meaning it will search the two page numbers you pass it and every number in between. To search just one page, pass the same number twice, or use the overloaded method that only takes one int parameter.
        Parameters:
        url - String strURL URL of the PDF
        expectedText - String Text to be checked in the PDF.
        pageStart - int Number of the page on the pdf to start looking for the text (inclusive).
        pageEnd - int Number of the page on the pdf to stop looking for the text (inclusive).
        Returns:
        boolean true if the text was found, false if it was not.
        Throws:
        IOException - if error while opening, stripping, loading, parsing, or closing PDF

      • verifyTextInDownloadedPDF

        public static boolean verifyTextInDownloadedPDF(String expectedText,
                                                File pdfFile,
                                                int pageStart,
                                                int pageEnd)
                                         throws IOException
        Returns true if the given text exists in the given PDF within a specified page range.
        Parameters:
        expectedText - String Text to be checked in the PDF.
        pdfFile - File A File handler to the file
        pageStart - int Number of the page on the pdf to start looking for the text (inclusive).
        pageEnd - int Number of the page on the pdf to stop looking for the text (inclusive).
        Returns:
        boolean true if the text was found, false if it was not.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws an error if the PDF file cannot be opened.

        Parameters:
        index - int page index of the page to be rendered
        pdfFile - File pdf containing image
        Returns:
        String file location of image.
        Throws:
        IOException - if error durring file io or during document load
